page.title: 04THE PARISH CHURCH, OAKE
page.content:
THE PARISH CHURCH AT OAKE IS CALLED ST. BARTHOLOMEW'S. IT IS MADE OF SANDSTONE. THE STONE IS A PINKY BROWN COLOUR LIKE MILVERTON CHURCH AND COMES FROM A QUARRY NEAR WIVELISCOMBE.
THE CHURCH HAS A LITTLE GRAVE YARD AROUND IT, FULL OF GRASS AND FLOWERS. THERE IS A YOUNG OAK TREE WHICH OAKE SCHOOL PLANTED IN CELEBRATION OF THE SCHOOL BIRTHDAY, WHEN THE SCHOOL WAS 100 YEARS OLD IN 1979. THE CHURCH IN OAKE IS DIFFERENT FROM MILVERTON BECAUSE IT IS MUCH SMALLER. ALSO, THE TOWER IS SHORTER. THE CHURCH HAS NOT VERY MANY PEWS, AND THE WALLS ARE PAINTED WHITE. THE WINDOWS ARE ALSO DIFFERENT BECAUSE THEY DO NOT HAVE ANY COLOUR.
OAKE CHURCH IS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE COUNTRYSIDE, A LONG WAY FROM OAKE.
